course.title: Advanced Industrial Organization
course.description: Theory and modern empirical techniques in industrial organization. Topics may include static analysis and estimation of market equilibrium; dynamic models of entry and investment; price discrimination, collusion, mergers and vertical control, with applications to antitrust policy; and issues in auctions and market design.
course.notes: Optional writing Requirement: This course offers an optional writing requirement which if completed will satisfy the concentration writing requirement. This is a hands-on course, and students will be expected to use Stata or other statistical software to perform data analysis.
